newsitem.title: USA: PRESS DIGEST - Daily Variety - November 20.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Daily Variety - November 20.

text.p: The following stories appeared in Wednesday's edition of Daily Variety:
HOLLYWOOD - Sony Corp confirmed plans to take its studio operations public but gave no time frame for the offering.

HOLLYWOOD - Fox Broadcasting Co of News Corp Ltd has restructured its entertainment arm, creating comedy and drama teams. The restructured programming department will be headed by Bob Greenblatt, executive vice president of programming.
HOLLYWOOD - Federal Communications Commission Chairman Reed Hundt threatened to launch a formal inquiry into hard liquor television advertizements if broadcasters do not reinstate the voluntary ban.

HOLLYWOOD - MCA Music Entertainment Group of Seagram Co Ltd has reached an agreement with Warner Chappell Music to purchase Warner's share of Interscope Records' music publishing in a deal valued at more than $50 million.
